content.question: Which of the following correctly identifies a Brønsted-Lowry conjugate acid-base pair in a solution prepared by mixing together <math alttext="H N O 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>HNO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> and <math alttext="N H 3, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>NH</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> ?

choices.label: The acid is <math alttext="H N O 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>HNO</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, and the conjugate base is <math alttext="N H 3, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>NH</mtext><mtext>3</mtext></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>.

The acid is <math alttext="H N O 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>HNO</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, and the conjugate base is <math alttext="N O 2 with a negative 1 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><msub><mtext>NO</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>.

The acid is <math alttext="N H 4 with a positive 1 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><msub><mtext>NH</mtext><mtext>4</mtext></msub><mo>+</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, and the conjugate base is <math alttext="N O 2 with a negative 1 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><msub><mtext>NO</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>.

The acid is <math alttext="N H 3, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>NH</mtext><mtext>3</mtext></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, and the conjugate base is <math alttext="N H 4 with a positive 1 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><msub><mtext>NH</mtext><mtext>4</mtext></msub><mo>+</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>.

content.answer: The acid is <math alttext="H N O 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>HNO</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, and the conjugate base is <math alttext="N O 2 with a negative 1 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><msub><mtext>NO</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msub><mo>−</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>.

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
